c74object.name: zsa.skewness~
c74object.digest:
zsa.skewness~
returns a measure of the asymmetry of a spectrum around its baricenter.
c74object.description:
zsa.skewness~
is considered as the third spectral moment. The spectral skewness value "sk" describes the degree of asymetry of a spectral distribution. sk = 0 indicates a symmetric distribution, sk < 0 indicates more energy on the right, sk > 0 indicates more energy on the left. The object works in the spectral domain, so you need to use it whithin
pfft~
.

method.name: signal
method.description:
If both signal inlets are connected, left signal inlet expects real values and right inlet expects imaginary values. If the left inlet is the only signal connected input, the signal is interpreted as the energy (you need to calculate it using
cartopol~
or better
zsa.energy~
).

attribute.name: threshold
attribute.description:
threshold
sets noise threshold in linear scale (the default value is 0.0). It helps
zsa.skewness~
to avoid calculating values on unwanted smaller low amplitude data.
